titles.title: HP153 Tell me the stories of Jesus

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Tell me the stories of Jesus
I love to hear;
Things I would ask him to tell me
If he were here;
Scenes by the wayside,
Tales of the sea,
Stories of Jesus,
Tell them to me.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
First let me hear how the children
Stood round his knee;
That I may know of his blessing,
resting on me
Words full of kindness
Deeds full of grace
signs of the love found
in Jesu's face

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Tell me, in words full of wonder,
How rolled the sea,
Tossing the boat in a tempest
On Galilee;
Jesus then doing
His Father's will,
ended the storm saying,
"Peace,peace, be still"

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Into the city I'd follow
The children's band,
Waving a branch of the palm-tree
High in my hand;
Worshiping Jesus,
Yes, I would sing
Loudest hosannas,
For He is King!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Show me that scene in the garden,
Of bitter pain;
And of the cross where my Saviour
For me was slain;
And, through the sadness,
Help me to see
How Jesus suffered
For love of me.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Gladly I'd hear of His rising
out of the, grave;
Living and strong and triumphant
mighty to save.
and how he sends us
all men to bring
Stories of Jesus,
Jesus, their king.
